sections.title: Gentle numbing with The Wand
sections.body: The Wand is a computer-assisted local anaesthetic system designed to deliver anaesthetic more slowly and precisely. For some patients, this can make numbing feel more comfortable, particularly in areas where injections can be sensitive. It’s not a guarantee of “no sensation,” but it can reduce the sharp pressure that people often worry about. We still take time to apply topical anaesthetic, explain what you’ll feel and use techniques that support comfort. If you’re anxious about injections, we’ll talk through options and agree a paced approach so you remain in control throughout treatment.
bullets: Fine control to reduce sudden pressure
Mapped numbing around the treatment area
Useful for nervous patients or longer visits

sections.title: We plan comfort before treatment begins
sections.body: Your clinician will explain the process, where numbing is needed, and how The Wand keeps flow steady. We discuss your comfort preferences, including options for anxious patients or those with a strong gag reflex.

faqs.question: How is The Wand different from a syringe?
faqs.answer: It uses computer-controlled flow and slim tips to deliver anaesthetic steadily, reducing sudden pressure.

faqs.question: Will it make my appointment longer?
faqs.answer: The start may be slower to prioritise comfort, but it’s planned into your appointment time.

faqs.question: Can it be combined with sedation?
faqs.answer: Yes, when suitable. We discuss whether sedation dentistry or other calming support is appropriate first.

faqs.question: Is it safe for emergency visits?
faqs.answer: Yes, we can use it in emergency care when time allows. You’ll still receive standard safety checks.

faqs.question: What if I still feel nervous?
faqs.answer: Tell us. We can pause, adjust, or explore additional calming options, including referrals to nervous patient resources.
